CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial;Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property
JUDGES: Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger;Volodymyr Butkevych;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant is a limited liability company registered in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company purchased an aircraft from ORG ( PERSON державне авіаційне підприємство , hereafter “ the Enterprise ” ) for MONEY ( ORG ) . By DATE this amount had been paid in full to the Enterprise . On DATE the applicant company and the Enterprise signed an aircraft acceptance certificate , entailing , according to the applicant company , the transfer of ownership . On DATE a NORP crew – including the chief pilot Mr DATE flew the aircraft to GPE .

CARDINAL . NORP Until DATE the aircraft underwent test flights at LOC , located in the GPE region . On DATE and for unspecified reasons , the aircraft was flown back to GPE where it landed at the Enterprise ’s airfield .

CARDINAL . In the meantime , namely on DATE , a ORG officer had drawn up a report that customs rules had been violated . According to this report , when the aircraft had crossed the NORP - Russian border in DATE , it had been declared by officials of the Enterprise as temporarily exported for test flights whereas it had in fact been exported by way of sale to the applicant company .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG authorities instituted criminal proceedings for the attempted smuggling of the aircraft to GPE . On an unspecified date the case was transmitted to ORG of ORG GPE по PERSON області , hereafter “ the USBU ” ) .

CARDINAL . By rulings of DATE and CARDINAL DATE , the ORG investigator decided to classify the aircraft as material evidence ( визнав речовим доказом ) and attached it to the case file pending the outcome of the criminal proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Deputy Head of ORG decided to put the aircraft up for sale by issuing a formal order to this effect ( ухвала про долю речового доказу ) .

CARDINAL . NORP By letter of CARDINAL DATE the Acting Head of ORG informed the applicant company that the aircraft had been acquired by ORG ( hereafter “ the Ministry ” ) for amount of USD CARDINAL,CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the ORG investigator charged PERSON with smuggling . In DATE , the same charge was brought against the Enterprise ’s Deputy Director General PERSON and DATE in DATE also against the Enterprise ’s Director General . The charge against the latter was subsequently dropped for lack of any corpus delicti .
CARDINAL . NORP By letter of DATE , the Deputy Prime Minister of ORG requested the Prime Minister of GPE to expedite the criminal proceedings relating to the aircraft at issue .

CARDINAL . On DATE the case was sent to ORG ( hereafter “ the ORG ” ) for trial proceedings . On DATE ORG allowed the applicant company to join the criminal proceedings as a civil claimant . On an unspecified subsequent date ORG joined the proceedings as a civil respondent .
CARDINAL . At a preparatory hearing on DATE ORG held that further investigations were required and remitted the case to ORG ( hereafter “ the ORG ” ) , which filed an appeal against this decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the prosecution ’s appeal , holding inter alia :
“ The AN-CARDINAL aircraft , which constitutes material evidence , was unlawfully sold at the pre - trial stage of the proceedings , thereby prejudging any subsequent court decision .

In view of the fact that [ the applicant company ’s ] ownership of the AN-CARDINAL aircraft is not disputed by anyone and that this company has been admitted as a civil claimant in the proceedings , the investigating authorities should take measures , as provided by law , in order to fulfil the claim in kind or to secure an equivalent amount of money . ”

CARDINAL . The Deputy Prosecutor of the Kharkiv Region filed a protest ( extraordinary appeal ) against ORG decisions of DATE and DATE . On DATE the ORG of ORG dismissed this protest . As regards the decision of DATE , it found no reason to deny the applicant company the status of civil claimant in this criminal case .
CARDINAL . On DATE , ORG submitted the case to ORG , which committed Mr I and Mr N for trial .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company requested ORG to quash the investigator ’s order of DATE to put the aircraft up for sale or , alternatively , to impound the aircraft pending trial . On DATE , ORG dismissed the first request and DATE accepting the applicant company ’s argument that operating the airplane would entail wear and tear and depreciate its value – accepted the request to impound the aircraft for the duration of the criminal proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of Kyiv arrested the aircraft which , at that time , was parked at GPE airport . However , according to a letter dated DATE by the Head of ORG , the arrest could not be maintained as the aircraft had disappeared from its parking place at this airport .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered ORG to inform the court of the whereabouts of the aircraft and to implement its seizure order of CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE filed a note with ORG of GPE , stating that it “ would be grateful for the return as soon as practically possible of the AN-CARDINAL aircraft to [ the applicant company ] ” .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG appealed against the seizure order of CARDINAL DATE to the President of ORG and requested its suspension pending the determination of the appeal . On DATE ORG granted this request and suspended the enforcement of the seizure order . No further information about these appeal proceedings has been submitted by the applicant company . Apparently , the seizure order has never been implemented .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided to disjoin the applicant company ’s civil claim from the criminal case , considering that it would be more appropriate to determine it in civil proceedings . The applicant company appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG found that the pre - trial investigations were insufficient and remitted the case to ORG . The accused Mr N. appealed .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG examined both appeals . It upheld ORG decision to remit the case for additional investigations , but quashed the impugned decision of DATE and reinstated the applicant company ’s status as civil claimant in the criminal proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG forwarded the case to ORG of Kharkiv ( hereafter “ the ORG ” ) for trial proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG accepted a request filed by the applicant company to seize the aircraft pending the trial proceedings .

CARDINAL . In the course of a hearing held on DATE , the ORG challenged the above seizure order on the ground that the law did not entitle a court to order a general seizure of ORG property , but only to order the owner to refrain from specified actions . ORG held that there was no proof that the ORG owned the impugned aircraft . In particular the sales contract was said to be lost and the license to operate the plane , issued by ORG , authorised a certain ORG unit to use it , without any reference being made as to who was its owner . However , the court decided to quash its ruling of CARDINAL DATE and prohibited the ORG from disposing of the aircraft in any form whatsoever and from moving it outside the GPE airport , where it was stationed at the material time .
CARDINAL . In the meantime Mr I. died and the charge against him was dropped .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG acquitted PERSON , who by that time had become the sole defendant in the proceedings , on the ground of lack of corpus delicti ( відсутність складу злочину ) . The court further held that that the investigating authorities’ decision to sell the aircraft was unlawful . Moreover , there was no cogent proof of the ORG ’s ownership of the aircraft . The aircraft , which thus remained the applicant ’s property and an item of material evidence , could be disposed of by a court in a judgment on the criminal case . Based on these findings ORG ordered that the aircraft be handed over to the applicant . It , however , found that it had no jurisdiction , in the criminal case , to entertain the applicant company ’s claims for damages against ORG , the Enterprise , the ORG and the ORG . The prosecutor , the applicant company , the ORG and PERSON N. ( who considered that he should have been acquitted for lack of any offence DATE відсутність події ) filed appeals against this judgment .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG ( hereafter “ the ORG ” ) decided not to entertain the prosecution ’s appeal on the ground that it was not signed by the prosecutor who had participated in the proceedings before the first instance court . The appeals of ORG , the applicant and PERSON were rejected as unsubstantiated . The same parties made cassation appeals .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the decision of DATE and remitted the case for fresh appellate hearing on the ground that ORG refusal to entertain the prosecutor ’s appeal had not been reasonable .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG granted the appeal of the prosecutor , quashed the judgment of CARDINAL DATE and remitted the case to ORG for further pre - trial investigations .
CARDINAL . The investigation in the case is still pending .
